id.description: Sets the id of this node

description.description: Sets the description of this node

group.description: The group that this route belongs to; could be the name of the RouteBuilder class or be explicitly configured in the Route definition. May be null.

nodePrefixId.description: Sets a prefix to use for all node ids (not route id).

routeConfigurationId.description: The route configuration id or pattern this route should use for configuration. Multiple id/pattern can be separated by comma.

autoStartup.description: Whether to auto start this route

startupOrder.label: advanced
startupOrder.description: To configure the ordering of the routes being started

streamCache.description: Whether stream caching is enabled on this route.

trace.description: Whether tracing is enabled on this route.

messageHistory.description: Whether message history is enabled on this route.

logMask.description: Whether security mask for Logging is enabled on this route.

delayer.description: Whether to slow down processing messages by a given delay in msec.

errorHandlerRef.label: error
errorHandlerRef.description: Sets the bean ref name of the error handler builder to use on this route

routePolicyRef.description: Reference to custom org.apache.camel.spi.RoutePolicy to use by the route. Multiple policies can be configured by separating values using comma.

shutdownRoute.label: advanced
shutdownRoute.description: To control how to shutdown the route.

shutdownRunningTask.label: advanced
shutdownRunningTask.description: To control how to shut down the route.

precondition.label: advanced
precondition.description: The predicate of the precondition in simple language to evaluate in order to determine if this route should be included or not.

errorHandler.label: error
errorHandler.description: Sets the error handler to use for this route

inputType.label: advanced
inputType.description: Declare the expected data type of the input message. If the actual message type is different at runtime, camel look for a required org.apache.camel.spi.Transformer and apply if exists. The type name consists of two parts, 'scheme' and 'name' connected with ':'. For Java type 'name' is a fully qualified class name. For example {code java:java.lang.String} , {code json:ABCOrder} .

outputType.label: advanced
outputType.description: Declare the expected data type of the output message. If the actual message type is different at runtime, camel look for a required org.apache.camel.spi.Transformer and apply if exists. The type name consists of two parts, 'scheme' and 'name' connected with ':'. For Java type 'name' is a fully qualified class name. For example {code java:java.lang.String} , {code json:ABCOrder} .

outputs.description: Outputs are processors that determines how messages are processed by this route.
